RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the front seat of the truck cab: front seat of the truck cab

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: location where the pickup truck was stopped, approximately 115 miles north of the Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where stops by border patrol agents may occur, commonly used for smuggling of aliens, and known for its reputation as a common smuggling route, with other highways intersecting it near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary relevant to the case and the Brignoni-Ponce test, with Interstate 35 being a common route leading to it
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.front seat of the truck cab: part of the truck where three women were seated
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.back seat of the truck: rear part of the truck cab where passengers were seated and attempting to conceal themselves, also referred to as the back seat or the seat in this context
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck: vehicle stopped on an Interstate Highway in Texas, containing a heavily loaded camper attachment, with occupants attempting to evade detection, searched by border patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron
